comment: Covers a lot of Supply Chain and Operations Management Theories, expert in his field with lots of practical experiences and consultation under his belt. Prepare yourself to read a lot of articles. Two projects, one group project and one individual paper. Tests are from lectures, pay attention and take good notes, you will get high grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He doesn't  waste time.  He starts class, reaches the end of the topic, and class is over.  Classes vary in length from 20 minutes to 1 1/2 hours, depending on the subject matter and his mood.  No clear indications of what will be on the test.  However, I recommend everything he puts on the whiteboard and his articles.  He knows his stuff.
does not make you crazy like some other professor do. classes are reasonably long. I personally enjoyed course a lot. I would take another course by him. I got A.

A very smart professor with lots of real world experience.  Class was much more interesting than I thought it would be.  Take good notes during class (anything on the whiteboard is likely to be on the test) and thoroughly read his assigned papers.  He even has a pretty good sense of humor!

Simply brilliant! He provided a-month long lean management training to our managers and supervisors. By implementing lean under his supervision, we have received impressive results - over $750,000 cost savings in 5 lean events.

Absolutely fantastic teacher!I am in his class now.  He does a great job teaching the class and always there! His articles are extremely helpful. His expectations in the tests are reasonable. I just hired him - as a "sensei" to work with my company's manufacturing workers and managers.
Good
Excellent coach of Lean Six Sigma (LSS) ! His two-week Continuous Improvement training to our Executives/Associates was better than any other consultant.

Take him. He's a a nice guy, and amazingly smart. I didn't learn as much from his lectures as I did his projects though (may be because I lack an interest in the subject). He didn't make us do the final but didn't give confirmation on that until we were in class ready to take it.
Great sensei!  We did 10 lean events and they saved us a ton of money.  Relates well with workers (with no education) and managers (with MBAs).

His lectures and articles on Lean Six Sigma are excellent! He is running many LSS projects for us and they are all going very well.  His suggestions saved us >$150,000. Nice ability to get along with executives, managers and workers
Great guy!  Many real world examples.
Very useful class! Good combination of projects and tests. Makes the class interesting!
Excellent class! Gives very good instructions! Love his examples!
Excellent class! Explains evertyhting well.  Gives good instructions for everything. I am not a big fan of Operations, but he does a great job!

He rambles on and on about himself. Making readings mandatory and then covering nothing in his lectures. it is so frustrating sitting in his class. test coming up No idea what will be covered. I will never take this man again
Excellent Theory of Constraints (TOC) teaching.  Nice mixture of Lean, Six Sigma, and TOC. Fantastic examples.  We will hire again!
Great class! Our executives loved his class.  Learned a lot from his class. Exceptional real world exmaples and many supporting articles

Excellent blending of Lean, Six Sigma, and Theory of Constraints. Great examples...Nice written articles...very down to earth.  Fits in well with upper management, works fine with shop floor workers. Excellent attitude.

Fantastic Lean Six Sigma (LSS) coach! Excellent training of LSS Black Belt and LSS Green Belt. Good examples from Management of Innovation and Reengineering of Business.  Both execs and workers liked his delivery and attitude in our company. His LSS projects saved us $250,000 and we still saving!

Very animated and fun prof. He's tough but fair. Don't be too intimidated by the amount of material. Just pay attention, take GOOD notes in class and be sure to make an effort to participate in class discussions. Heavy reading but not unreasonable. Just make a good effort and you'll do fine. He won't give a C or lower unless you deserve that.

Great Sensei! Taught us Lean principles - Poka-Yoke, SMED, Cells, and how to perform value stream mapping. We identified many non-value added activities. Returns were huge on lean events - both in office and operations. Well organized excellent examples. Fantastic attitude!

Excellent teaching! He taught our Executive Group Lean and Six Sigma.  He gave brillaint exmaples, provided lively discussions, and cited solid research. His articles were very useful as they were based on his experience of implementations.
Explained theory of constraints(TOC) well. In simple terms- good job!
Superb! Good examples of value stream mapping. Well prepared presentation on SMED, POka-Yoke, Cells, and TPM. Learned how to effectively implement Lean Programs.
Off the charts! Nice presentation of Six Sigma training.  Excellent examples from Lean and other areas.  I am GE black Belt (ASQ Certified) but, his training was better. Take him (hire him).
Superb!
Good trainer! He taught our group (manufactruing supervisors) and learned a lot. His statistical examples were good. He will train 232 guys.  WE ARE LUCKY!

Great experience. I took his class when I was at UGA (1988). After 20 years, I took him again in KSU (2008.  He was great then, he is great now ,...into the future. He treates you with respect. Excellent class!
Hard class. Lot of reading and writing. Excellent class delivery and good in class discussion. Like is sense of humor

One of the best classes in the program. Excellent class delivery. Always came prepared to the class and made the delivery interesting. Gave many real world examples. I did not come from Operations background but, learned a lot from the class. Very helpful.  Goes out of his way to help. I will definitely take him again. Great expereince!
A complete jerk in every facet of the word, arrogant pompus, condescending. You name it this guy displays it.

The course topic could have been very useful if the teacher would have cared to teach us in a useful way.  He didn't even want to be here.  None of the information was even useful.  He talked about himself more than he talked about the material.

This was the biggest waste of my money yet.  He does not teach.  All the professor talked about was how much money he made, and how little we were worth.  Spare me!  This is one of the worst classes I have ever taken.  Talk about a non-value added activity.

How do we keep professors that are not willing to provide to students, an overall plan from which to base thier learning and goals for class study??? Also, I am in shock and awe with the lack of diversity training - OMG!  Totally UNAPPROACHABLE- and revels in this - not the type of professor to learn from; a total 'space' filler....
Very excellent and knowledgeable with more to teach than just the subject if the student is willing to listen.
Simply time pass. Learned nothing from the class. No continuity in what he is saying. He needs to be well organized and should make good use of students' time.
He is very passionate abt the subject, but is very clear on the material and gives a fair exam.
Thinks highly of himself and his teachings.  Get on his good side if you want an A.

Dr. Chakravorty is very passionate about the subject matter.  Likes to use socratic method for teaching.   Uses guided questions, but class wasn't very interactive and therefore most of the questions went unanswered.   Frustrating and didn't learn a whole lot.  Found the manufacturing simulation game to be poorly explained.
This was the best class for students who did not mind the hard work. Straight to the point professor. You don't even have to take finals if you got an A in mid-term. He is great!
Spends lots of class time going over American shortcomings in corporations and personal. Very opinionated, but makes you think. Study really hard for the mid-term. Take only if you have to.

Definitely has a very inflated ego.  His grading seems random: if he likes you, you get good grades, if not, you don't.  Material is interesting but it seems like in the end you don't really know much more than before the class.
